nature maiestyher maie •• comfort ministery whose clemencie knowne church yea world enemy especially al louing obedient subiects chiefly godly minister rich poore also honorable counsell ready helpe comfort godly minister offer wrong vnto poorest thē would vpon iust complaint quickly help matter néede complain also deceaued hope expectation whiche great blot vnto honour willingly suffer wronges calme day maiesties peaceable mercifull prosperous godly reign likely matter themselues either faithfull godly pretende quiet disposition obedient maiesties lawes superior ought else matter whereby c • oubt maiesties honorable counsel care zealous holy hath trust habilities abounded performing ought haue done héerein euen therfore brother offer th • another iniury yea driuing cananits bene indéede hope expectation bene satisfied long ago cananits remayning haue bene driuen sort • ought might haue done haue done cananits meane papist aptl • compared idolatrous israelits iewes cananits méere heathen although sense may cōpared yet cananites vtterlye driuen • would become religion true israelits rahab gibeonits c permitted abide farre christian charged cō mandement notwithstanding expresse commaundement giuen contrary whereas christian haue especiall generall charge driue cleane haue beene papistes superstitious idolatrous heritikes insidels truely conuerted faith religion iesus christe else ha • christ translated church iewes gentile god praised hath conuerted last day infinite papist gospell meane remaine papist doe think • shew maintained ministery although wordes runne large cleane driuing cananits papistes realme state condition soeuer much better opinion agréeable mercye gospell clemency maiesties holy zealous care abounddifference opē couert obstiuare chapter irenaeus vseth name bish prieste indifferētly hee generally calleth apostle successor priest li 4 cap 44 c yet followeth eyther eusebius irenaeus tooke bishop priest al one aequal dignity though vse name indifferently after▪ appropriating name person speak priest bishop though euery priest pastoral elder name bishop made peculier one properly bishop yet euery bishop properlie priest pastorall elder therefore might well called name bicause vsed one rather argueth marke muche interchaungeable vsing name whether party alike equall degree dignity many time communicate like name shall finde bishop onelye superiours dignitie aboue pastorall elder aboue euangelistes remayning apostle time bishoppe alexander shall afterward sée sent euangeliste pantenus india preach gospell bishop god smyrna god father iesus christe sonne woorking togeather holieghoste congratulate vnto mee beeing bounde christe iesu might see fulnesse receauing therefore according vnto god haue acknowledged beneuolence finding bee follower iesus christe sauiour bee yee subiecte bishoppe lorde watcheth soules shall giue account god thing yee shall seeme vnto mee liue according fleshe liue according iesus christe dyed v wee beleeuing deathe might baptisme bee made partaker resurrection necessarie shoulde doe nothing take ought hande meaneth concerning ecclesiasticall cause bishoppe submitte selues priestes elder apostle iesu christe hope whome abiding wee shall founde must also therefore meanes please deacon practise bishop superioritye ministerie iesus christe eor minister meate drinke alludeth table whereon attended minister churche god yee must therfore obserue commaund euen fire burning let suche reuerence ye euen lord iesus christe keeper placethe bishop distinguished frō priest euen bishop forme type father priest euen assemblie god coniunction apostle christe c againe hath warned take héede scismes seducer puffed vp pride exhorted humilitie saithe yet reuerence bishop euen christe according blessed apostle haue commaunded hee placed betweene altare worde altare often vsed auncient father lord table héere meant participation holye communion cleane obey bishop priest elder placed without aultar dooing somewhat without bishop priest deacon hee shall suche one excludeth himselfe participation diuine misteries deliuered bishop priest deacon polluted conscience woorse infidell bishop one holding principalitie power ouer thus farre foorth becommeth man holde made follower god according vertue priesthood eldership holie institution counsellor confessor bishop bishopricke also sawe apostle conferred word doth include ierome gathereth peter haue beene first bishop maketh reckoning beginning firste linus anacletus thirde clemens procéeding till come bishop owne time saying nunc duodecimo loco episcopatum ab apostolis habet eleutherius nowe twelfth place eleutherius hath bishopricke apostle still hee excludeth apostle beeing number bishop themselues onely maketh founder constitutors instructor church saith knowne men except wil vtterly cast irenaeus notable lyar héerein notoriously erred bishop also maister polycarpus sée howe manifestly falleth name bishoppe bee made peculiar proper one residue pastor one bishop haue superior gouernement authoritie churche aboue pastor onelie practise primitiue churche nexte apostle verie founding ordeining apostle themselues neither point poperie pope pretended claime succéeding peter héere established many church bishop rome although héere mentioned church ought agree churche rome yet noteth agreement must doctrine héere set downe let churche rome agree let call agreement churche rome sithe churche rome nowe differeth notoriouslie manie great point yea cleane contrarie therevnto must néeds differ churche rome maye agree churche rome disagreement haue placarde also euen selfesame father irenaeus ireneus acquittance disagreement victor followed eleutherius contrarie went beyond bound iraeneus highlie commended good predecessor sharpelie reprooue euill successor said church must agree churche rome euen churche manie moe church dissent therein churche rome bishop thereof wherevpon erasmus grineus maketh good caution margine wordes church ought agree churche romehow much giuen church rome howe muche giuen churche rome hold doctrine apostle neither yet dooth irenaeus mention agreeing churche rome whatsoeuer superioritie bishop among owne cleargie people obedience church church therevnto although alleage mightie reason church agree churche rome mightie principalitie church euen time mightie churche one principall church worlde yet might consisted worldlie mightwherin might principalitie churche rome consisted anye claime principalitie ouer church peter paule pretended purpose mightie constant defence maintenance syncere faithe christe lesse defiled schismes heresy church time therefore light looked vpon honoured renowned worlde lesser distracted church neither mightie principalitie giuen bishop church although principalitie respect ouer clergie churche yet whole church respectes church rome principalitie mightier principalitie aboue yea euerie pastorall elder respectes equall one mightie letter written true clement church corinthe irenaeus called clements vnder clement church rome wrote mightie effectuall letter corinthian c therefore sayth eusebius ierome wrote person romaine church superioritie tyrannie bishop obedient consent readie approbation church nowe although bishop irenaeus afterwarde called also sacerdotes presbyteri sacerdotall elderly priestes minister god woordethe gouernment church rome equall euery pastor appeareth epistle cited eusebius lib 5 cap 24 wrote victor bishop rome eleutherius rashe excommunicating easterne bishop dissenting controuersie celebrating easterday yet giueth gouernement church rome pastorall elder alike one ouer euen hee calleth also name priest elder still confirmeth question reckon damasus though auncient recordes howe manie bishop howe many priestes ministring elder manie deaconsmany priest pastorall elder rome bish bishop rome made dayes eusebius whome dare better credite therein settes downe dare make argument euen time eusebius noteth lib 5 cap 15 citie rome one florinus certaine priest degree fell church shall say florinus priest rome pastoral elder therfore bishop rome also plaine therefore though degree priesthood equall one yet dignitie gouernement churche great difference appeareth better eusebius noteth pacifying controuersie easterday eusebius hauing reckoned without thinges thinges following rule faith yea polycrates also leaste amongest doe obserue according tradition father onely whome haue followed euen beginning seuen parentes haue beene bishoppes order eight haue also thus obserued daie mighte agree daye wherein people iewes remooued leauen controuersie easter wherefore deere brother name lorde threescore fiue yeares olde hauing also full vnderstanding manie bishop throughout worlde intentiuely marking scripture mooued thinges set make men afrayde sithe mineelders haue also sayde wee must obey god men fewe wordes setteth vnder concerning bishop present could also make mention bishop selues desired shoulde call foorth also haue doone whose name write great multitude knowing businesse haue confirmed thinges write consent hath discorde faste broken concorde faith irenaeus reprehension victor inserteth certaine storie fitnes therof ought omitted conclude saith priestes elder soter helde sacerdotall sacred priesthood vnto keepe also like manner yet neuer repulsed societie church came coastes receaued yea rather priest elder also haue beene haue solemnely sent eucharist vnder correction take héere age manie mystery holie communion selfe rather auncient custome honour courtesie sende bread wine say vnto comming towne worde eucharist may well beare comitas gratitudo ierome calleth gratiositas call thankefulnesse courtesie priestes elder church obseruing blessed polycarpus came citie rome vnder anicetus little iarre betweene manie thinges neuerthelesse ioyned themselues streightwaies togeather peace handled matter question neither defended opinion anie obstinate contending neither anicetus could perswade polycarpus hee obserue thinges knowen iohn disciple lord apostle whome hee alwaies beene obserue neyther againe polycarpus perswaded anicetus forsake thinges sayde kept manner auncestors thinges thus betweene communicate together insomuch anicetus graunted polycarpus onelie contemplation honour exercise function sacerdotall ministerie full faith entire peace stedfast charitie parted asunder church whether keepe easterday notwithstanding shoulde keepe concorde among thinges writeth irenaeus anothers necke though greater greater matter graunted fine force confessed reuerends lieralitie • 〈◊〉 whereas indéede either lesse lesse graunted much pulled backe else conclusion commeth former stoppe wiping away name title euangelist length confessed timothie gouerned thinges direction one degree aboue elder nowe authoritie laying handes one thing thinges gouerned direction commeth graunt vpon imposition handes let v graunt epiphanius gouerne thinges direction rather mought much better haue saide let v denie wee haue graunted thinges graunt lesse lesse howe come thinges graunts reuerende learned man though laye frée choise liberall graunt commeth woordes apostle laye handes suddenlie vppon anie come wordes howe dare graunt graunt vntruthe wordes enforce gramercie paules word graunt graunteth nothing driuen vnto yet another grant perhaps frée woorth taking handes saith let v graunt duty belonged gouernours duty trowe speketh named one ceremony laying hand gouernours saith belonged vnto meane gouernours doe brother learned discoursers segniorie elder pastor haue spunne faire threade gotten goodly catch graunts meane gouernors pastor superioritie gouerning fellowe bretheren pastor imposition handes pertayneth onely chiefely vnto graunteth héere timothie graunte indéede graunttimothie • superioritie impositiō handes laste graunt ta • thankefully handes though ordination minister place moste ample needefull bee knowne wont heere bee enquired oughte ordeine bee ordeyned concerning former apostle place attributeth titus alone titu • ordained elder alone creta regarded matter coulde haue perfourmed magistrate yet heathen titus moste rightly enstructed apostle endued giftes holy ghoste day another reason wee haue faythfull magistrate christian people therefore force election pertayneth onely minister although heere appertaine titus alone therefore church speaketh territory belonging lord berne heluetia doe keepe manner minister doe indeed elect notwithstanding offer thē senate present election quéenes maiesty coūsel either alloweth disaloweth election according vnderstande matter oftentimes also consent whole church sought ouer whome minister bee preferred thus sayth aretius onelye order ordeyning minister different example titus rule prescribed learned discoursers also shewe titus whole onely gouernment thinges neither auayleth caluine aunswereth owne obiection though wee haue noted aunswering moste reuerende learned man hee vrged election cheefe grounde churche office caluines obi • ction answere titus authority electing ordeining pastor dependeth voyces whole company yet pardonable let v againe consider obiection aunswere hee seemeth sayth caluine permitte muche titus hee commaundeth sette minister ouer church almoste kinglike power moreouer meanes taken away euery church right electing iudgement colledge pastor prophane holy administration church aunswere sayth caluine heereunto easy permitted titus hee might doe thing alone place bishop ouer church whome hee pleased onely hee commaundeth gouern election moderator euen necessary speeche common ynough consull hee supplieth place king vacancy dictator archbishop yea 4 patriarkes euen nicene councell selfethe reason serued b serueth archb wee thinke may excused defended although thinges successe time afterwardes drawen awaye vnto greatest tyrannie ambition cause neerer wee approche order apostolicall simplicitie muche also v allowed iudge euery endeuour approch thereto nowe zanchius hath added certaine aphorismes concerning church lawfull minister thereof setteth downe aphorism 20 authoritie saying beleeue alsowhereto far minister auth stretcheth great authoritie christe giuen vnto lawfull minister wit performe thinges whereunto also called preach gospell interprete holy scripture according analogie faith catechise teach people god reprooue rebuke well great small remitte reteyne sinnes ministerially binde impenitent loose repentant administer also sacrament christ instituted according manner deliuered exercise discipline prescription christe also expounding apostle conclude thing also though expressed holy scripture notwithstanding appertaine order comlinesse make edification destruction according generall rule deliuered apostle thinges ought doone order decently aedification neither doe beleeue1 cor 1440 authoritie giuen minister ought stretched beyonde boundes god worde vnto anie ende aedification church therefore vtterly deny bishophow farre debatted yea together haue authoritie ordeyning thing contrarie scripture adding thing vnto takeing thing making newe article faith instituting new sacramentes bringing church new worship setting forth lawes bind conscience made equall authoritie lawe god hauing dominion church conscience faithfull forbidding thinges god hath graunted would haue bee free finally commanding thing without worde god though necessarie saluation sithe truely sayde indeede whole church hath authoritie hauing thus euery particuler set downe limited authoritie lawefull minister church according worde god procéedeth aphorisme 21 vnto aphor 21 politike authoritie submit themselues liues common rule men somewhat darkely straungely spoken brother meane submission themselues liues common rule men haue superior ecclesiastical authority ouer men men aequal alike ecclesiastical gouernment vnto rather ouerseers men shoulde rule ouersight vnder inferior rule also common rule men▪ manifest absurdity al reason plaine contradiction selfe neither peter apostle submit themselues neither timothy titus bidden paul submit themselues neither doth peter el wil bish pastor elder neither peter paul require submission al humulity minde dilig • nce body teaching c neuerthelesse ouersee commaund rebuke rule gouerne men minister according place calling authority god committed vnto thus embrace withall excellent vertues sure bee plentifully rewarded truely said whose dignitye conteyneth absolute either power title stretcheth nothing néere halfe quarter scarse handfull comparison elder pastor bishop bownded onelye little corner portion church realme england tendring libertie life man yet al king prince whō god hath giuen power sword though selues substituts god make substitute power thereby iudges euen substitute substitute punish offender iustice require euen death yea substitute also vnder doe execute sentence substitute hath also law man expresse exception c de iudice • st extra dele super quorum vicarius vicarium constituere non potest bene well supplyed churche haue reste peace free preaching gospell bridge 25 26 yeeres since also 27 28 vpward vnder protection gratious queene much bound thankfulnesse first almightye god vnto moste gratious queene reacknowledge may ashamed haue suche rest peace free preaching gospell protection disturbance forraine enemy haue home continuallye ceased disturbe rest peace contention diuisions pronouncing prayer thinke pertaineth thē giue eare consent mind vnto thē kind pronouncing pronoūced shuld breth pronounce therfore till ye abuse playner pronounced breth neither denownce fault finde lie whether pronouncer hearer howe helpe wee might renounce till knowe better meane ill pronouncing reading mean • nister pronounceth prayer bee vnderstoode • hey make another fault seuered excepted saying afterwarde wee speake heere insensible reader whose voyce eyther cannot heard else non vnderstoode fault pronouncer prayer prayer pronounced minister diligence pronounce ought yet must diligence marke well may howsoeuer pronounce yet cannot rightly thinke prayer pertaine though brother say worst disposed word whō aime darkly pronounced sure best disposed indéede badde disposed thinke onely minister pronounce also worst disposed think one pronouncing hee pronounce well good lewde opinion thinking good prayer pertaine faultie punishable pray god none brother selues graunt worste disposed thinke pertayneth giue eare consent vnto wee thinke thinke better thus write would haue thē cleane taken away though fashion sake finde fault pronounced indéede allowe well pronounced person man wife respect wifehoode subiect husbande otherwise woman superior respectes meanes superiour person onely monarke ouer men kingdome neither yet haue ladiship ouer countrie mistresse houshold man though méere seruant stranger soiorne house shee may haue higher authoritie respect higher person wherunto called ouer men seruaunts family towne countrie may notwithstanding sexe retayne highest sentence olde newe testament haue alreadie séene whether chiefe gouernour man woman come estate godly meanes sex debarre without preiudice kind one may far stretcheth publike preheminence gouerne direct yea chiefe gouernor moe one case although caenalis say contrarie yet sée two cannot sorte equally gouernours one like either whole euen one state yea one monarchie empire sayde gerion spaine whome poetes feyned hée 3 body one head three brother vnited themselues equally altogether one gouernement like euen monarchie rome diuerse emperours although deuided country prouinces possession yet empire remayned one among empire gouerned ioyntly equall dignitie though one one ouer vnder thē woman also shall sée danaeus shall call v exāples state sufficeth haue séen popish bishop caenalis vseth reason also caluine danaeus stande vpon howe weake argumentes residue followeth caenalis parte either vaine babling without proofe fonde argumentes caenalis thinges therefore sayth fol 66 fight themselues chiefe monarke woman denie consequence neither followeth premiss bridge sayth whosoeuer therefore doubteth thing caenalis heareth himselfe speaking knowing force word whether caenelis heard himselfe say rather thinke heard himselfe much bridge bewrayeth owne ignoraunce woorde monarchie else signifie principalitie chiefe gouernement one included worde monarke sexe one chiefe gouernour chiefe gouernement one moe sayth kingdomes claime chief gouernment themselues caenalis admitting chiefe right kingdome woman seeme doe nothing else diminish maiestie monarchicall principalitie hauing right thereto bridge otherwise demerites barred woman claime monarchie themselues diminishing maiestie monarchicall principalitie still remayneth entier speake men wordes haue sense claime selues chief gouernment kingdomes withall admit chiefe right kingdom woman except whosoeuer would confesse himselfe plaine vsurper confessing chiefe right yet claime chiefe gouernment himselfe meane title right present right possibilitie deuolueth woman neither diminisheth whitte maiestie monarchicall principalitie lawfully atteyneth thereunto whit diminisheth reason sexe except demerites otherwise diminish perhaps may lose may happen hath hapned man well vnto woman matter sayth caenalis let looke witte caenalis english men spaniardes sicilian well ne • sith englande spaine sicile bridge almost doe admitte right argueth vnlawefull vnnaturall thing almost christendome acknowledgeth womā right regiment except french would condemne part christendom owne peuish standing salike lawe confesse came infidelles england haue good companie herein let french rather looke vnto separate themselues maintenance pagan lawe rather lawe méere forged part christendome monarchie kingdom christendome france monark woman repugnant doubt therof heares himselfe knowes force worde monarke signiories residue ditions signiories sayth caenalis howe excellent soeuer caenalis dignitie principalitie safe supreme monarchicall may admit feminine sexe succession lande bridge make exception residue ditions signiories englandecaenalis graunt others segnioties woman gou spaine sicill granteth admit woman supreame gouernement signiories speaketh haue plainer expressed signiories soeuer meane municipall lawes soeuer haue sith graunteth excellent soeuer may admitte woman kinde succession soyle dignitie principalitie safe vnblemished yet dignitie annexed possession soyle doth graunt woman may gouerne neuer excellent signiorie dition territorie without impayring dignitie principalitie thereof may doe exception supreme monarchicall come late vaine exception neither reason hereof value debarre woman right succession kingdom princedom dukedome sayth shall want top soueraigntie monarchie caenalis defence armes shal supply fraylty sex defending restoring right cannot done well better subiects confederate bridge whē selfe hath monarchical principalitie may men pretende well much easier take away erledome dukedome princedome inferiour signiories imbecilitie mā childe weakenes vpon pretence defence take away right kingdom yea reason n • male heyre yet childe enioy monarchie fraylti • age well sexe defending restoring right must supplyed force armes lie little doe woman sayth caenalis monarchie woman gouerne necessarie man subiect woman caenalis al disposing holy prophane lawe well may disposing prophane pretended salike lawe bridge haue shewed sufficiently yea caenalis hath sufficiently confessed holy lawe god man may subiect woman respect person vocation without subiection child women▪ like child wit destitute counsel prudence moreouer god exerciseth punishment two way oftentimes seem ourselues haue graue men skilfull thing come matter blunder like blind men haue liked pilled wicked exaction sith therefore child coulde exactors cānot wel vnderstand word yeres child neither sexe woman spoken natural sense child woman lawful prince doth prooue much though woman child curse literally vnderstood yet still cōfirms lawfulnes state albeit also cur alwaies god haue prince shal sée anone euen danaeus reuocation yet principality euen lawful state although nature better twayne men coulde alwayes haue wishe haue prince rather bée man woman bée man ripe perfect age infant childe yet notwithstanding sithe neither infirmitie sexe age debarreth lawefulnesse estate husbandes would encrease rather hinder propagation child sayth augustine multitude wiues therefore displeased god father god also wanton lust vaunt self abundantly estsoones holy womē likewise ech principalitie shee principall ouer manye men subiectes hath word meaning similitude prince state ciuillthe plaine meaning aug prooueth order naturall oeconomicall state sithe naturall order mā sexe oeconomicall principalitie sex matrimony mean admitted husband head natural prince mo thā one womā subiect lawe naturall oeconomicall one one woman haue mo husband whereas law god ben ben orderly twaine one man haue moe wiues permitted propagation mankinde commeth néerer order ciuill state one prince may haue moe subiectes yet sheweth similitude aug true meaning lawe naturall oeconomicall gouernement matrimonie differeth also comparison lawe ciuill gouernement marriage must chiefely leueled proportion first institution law whereof two though processe time bredde permission contrarie respect whereof nowe sithe néede therefore mariages ought one man hee principall one woman subiect whereas politicall ciuill principalitie one prince many subiectes therefore comparison two kindes principality doe simply resemble imitate one otherdanaeus striketh verie word shew aug meaning take augustine plaine meaning sentence cited danaeus béene plaine inough set downe whole wordes thereof neither doubted naturall order men rather principall woman woman men may easily perceaue speaketh simply principalitie principalitie onely ariseth naturall order denieth purpose politicall order yet denie two order naturall politicall orderly ioyned together better naturall order also inheritance woman may néerer ciuill principalitie man whereunto whē ciuill law yea law god acreweth withall ciuill political principality natural order inheritance woman gouernmēt ouer mā debarred naturall prerogatiue man sexe mariage ouer womā whē done sentence augustine absolute prohibition woman principalitie ouer men rather case allowe saith doubted natural order men rather principall womē woman men speake much naturall order neither speak twaine rather men might haue choise haue prince would must glad least wise content thē may god law nature calleth woman ciuill principalility must stande descanting rather haue obey thē higher power god whether mē womē sith augustine sentence cited danaeus grounde thereof doth say principalitie also naturally one ouer manys aug alloweth woman principalitie ouer men many ouer one aug place clearely alloweth ciuill principality vnto woman must néedes fall either hee must admitte state woman gouernment among amazon men else woman gouernour might haue principalitie ouer men nowe plac • weake aug woman gouernment inferre thing woman choose yea supposing béene suche brother suppose neither coulde bée hath probability contrarie testimonyes coniectures reason haue séene open ynough beza open cyprian ambrose auncient almoste two gouerned college elder hee shoulde reigne according sentence hee gouerne ecclesiasticall policy euer come sée quotation manner elder soeuer whether beza goeth prooue brother vrge yea let fall shall first worth noting bishop gouerned college elder aboue action two set dayes▪ moneths yeares continued college continued time except depriued life deposed dignity exiled country gouernment b permanent otherwise absent fled cyprian himselfe fled college reason perhaps personall persecution yet hée remayned still well absent present gouernor yea sayth beza reigne god forbid wee shoulde allowe bishoppe raigne ouer whome hée hath gouernment let bee vpbrayded pope wee houlde selues content beza sayth hee shoulde rule ecclesiasticall policy yea sayth beza according sentence rule giue sentence onely rule according sentence doe rather rule hee 〈…〉 better seruaunt officer executioner sentence gouernors therefore shoulde opened yet plaine meant sentence farre stretcheth else yet made beza open ynough whome gouernment doth belong farre foorth belonges hee still superior therein nowe shall fall college elder ouer bishop gouernor shall prooue college elder medled well teaching worde gouernment ecclesiasticall discipline bee elder brother office eldership call presbyter preestes haue wée héere againe permanent superiority bishop ouer pastorall elder whereof wee haue much debated beza goeth another matter cleane contrary prooue college elder elder medlers teaching wordebezaes confession elder gouerning b time persecution wee shall sée anone triall epistle cyprian yet sayth beza then▪ especially time church aphrica helped magistrate rather moste cruelly vexed meaneth beza come especially time heathen magistrate persecution gualter maketh reason elder teaching though ecclesiasticall gouernors brother imagine churche wanted christian magistrate prince thing hee inferre theron syth christian magistrate prince • gouernement ecclesiasticall matter well temporall perteineth them▪ also acknowledge moste rightly queenes excellent maiesty right christian prince therefore defect beeing nowe furnished supply elder needlesse longer necessary yea shoulde nowe preiudiciall authority gouernment christian prince thing sayth gualter reason beza doth inferre brother reason paule wordes 1 tim 517 paule bringeth wordes bezaes word confirme gualters especially labour worde doctrine therfore gouerning elder teacher may reason well much better sith elder teacher onely ruled eccl discipline especially time church holpen magistrate therefore nowe holpen magistrate néede elder ruler might haue saluted letter whole cleargy intyre safe malicious tempest hath beaten downe people moste part hath hence also added heape vnto greeues insomuch slaughter thereof hath wrung portion also cleargy beseeche lorde wee may salute whome wee knowe stande constancie vertue power fayth beeing protected heereafter also mercy god although cause compell mee selfe ought hasten come vnto first shoulde abide warie refraining rashly commit selfe vnto place often inquired sought reposing selfe therefore loue religon haue knowne sufficiently doe letter exhort commaund charge youet hortor mando consent people grace god shall come vnto wee treat common thinges either done done according mutuall honor doth require epistle sayth wil treat together common cyprian ioined common coun • ell elder authority reserued thinges concerne gouernment church therein nothing without counsell howbeit maketh nothing else determination himselfe neither giueth common ioint aequall authority thinges right office otherwise hee made deputy authority thereof yea hee onely exhorteth commaundeth chargeth stande steede doth absence recommendeth authority presence although therfore presence among would thinges consult examine sayth file matter counsell many plus vident oculus quam oculus yet wee gather thereupon counsell treating common argueth authority gouerning thinges common also among attributeth elder thus much elder councell people con • ent hee wold doe nothing without counsell addeth without cōsent people consent counsell man may giue counsell yet may done without consent shall done without consent hath greater stroke therein giuing aduice counsell shall wee say people also authority greater authority gouernment church discipline elder humble curteous spéeches therfore asunder concorde brotherhoode helde well together among selues loued one another certainelye sithe according bignesse thereof rome ought goe carthage hee hath committed greater greeuous thinges hee heere churche made deacon made bishoppe neyther let anye man meruayle suche kinde men euill euer caried madde furye haue committed wickednesse vexed conscience selfe wicked minde neither abide church punishmentes wee see furyenouatus vnnaturalnesse towardes father wife childe father also died famine village yet afterward hee deade hee buried foote hee strake vviues bellye whereuppon shee congregation praying vnto god though prayer wee strined workes force acceptable vnto god pray also emperours minister power state worlde quietnes affayres prolonging ende gathered together reciting diuine scripture qualitie present time doe compell v giue forewarning reknowledge certainely feede faith holy speech erecte hope fixe confidence neuerthelesse thicken encrease discipline maisters neither sheweth meant ecclesiasticall men speaketh senate wee gather nothing directly either elder ecclesiasticall person hee meant elder teacher minister word • sacramentes meant epistle place church hath senate elder ecclesia habet senatum catum presbyterorum c church hath senate company elder without whose consent lawfull monkes doe thing roboam sonne solomon therefore leese kingdome hee woulde heare elder romaynes also senate whose counsel thinges wee haue senate company assembly elder wordes plaine church hath senate senate company elder also monkes coulde doe nothing without counsell howbeit canon applieth restraint b monkes wee shoulde vnderstande bishop also canon doth yet counsell necessary consent much lesse ioint authority question nowe manner elder canan lawe ought deposed without examination councel many tyrannicall power▪ authoritie canonicall doe condemne haue bene examined exalt fauour sake debase hatred enuy condem vpon le ui aura lighte blast opinion better euidence prooue elder first driuen bare name howbeit neither much named bare name name hath cleane contrarie sense yet forsooth must imagine christ meant br say christe said although matter much vrged importance bene requisit heard christes wordes gathering christes meaning euidence yet admit meaning neuer néerer anie consistorie senate segniotie elder br pretend well might set vp rather may discerne cleane vncleane sorte therefore sacerdotall preeste maketh leper clean vncleane also eyther bishop preeste elder bindeth looseth eyther innocent offender according office hee shall haue hearde diuersities sinnes knoweth bee bound loosed saint augustine complained vnto auxilius young bishop made rash excommunicationaug ad auxilium epistola 75 hierome spake writeth vnto manner augustine moste dearely beloued lorde worshipfull reuerend brother fellow sacerdotall preeste auxilius renowned sonne classicianus hath greeuously letter complayned vnto mee hath susteined holinesse haue accursed body house perhaps demaunded might bee found able render reason body demaund whether well done finde shold answere neuer durst thing haue bin mooued greeuously wicked deedes moste cruelly committed church lord haue reuealed may iustly done despise neuer whit yong age rudimēts yong beginning eccl honor beholde hand old man yong fellow b▪ b many year colleague yet one yeare ready learn may render iust account eyther god men punish spiritual punishment innocent soules offence another whome take adam whome haue sinned originall sinne sonne classicianus haue taken father sinne first man bee washed away fountayne baptisme notwithstanding hee begat whatsoeuer sinne father committed wherein himselfe partaker doubteth pertaineth many soules whole housholde whereupon one soule seuerity whereby whole house accurseds aug er • infant dying without baptisme perish departing body without baptisme death body innumerable men bee taken church killed comparable losse therefore render reason matter woulde god woulde also writing againe yeeld also might able shoulde doe vnaduised passion minde whereof shoulde demaunded finde right reason haue sayde thinges yea although sonne classicianus hath committed ought may seeme bee moste iustly punished accursing howbeit hee hath written true letter vnto neither ought much hee alone house haue beene punished sentence hereon meddle nothing holines request woulde forgiue asking pardon hee shall acknowledge fault shall wisely acknowledge hee hath offended hee house faith hath iustly required fayth ought bee kept least shoulde bee broken taught doe holy man ought doe haue happened man thing verily man god speaketh psalme mine eye troubled wrath shoulde crye god mercy mee lorde weake may reache right hande represse wrath caulme minde see doe righteousnesse written wrath man worketh righteousnesse god iames 1 let v rather thinke wee men wee liue moste daungerously among snare tentations take away therefore ecclesiasticall actes haue done beeing done peraduenture perturbation let charity come agayne betweene yet catechumenus scholler learner catechism remoue strife reuoke peace leaste man freende perish deulll foe reioyce ouer mercy god mighty also graunt mee praying leaste heauinesse ouer bee encreased rather already sprung vp may healed woulde erect grace reioyse youth contemning mine olde age haue set downe whole epistle well reuerende stile thereof aug dissaloweth b exc one bishop thus writing another matter excommunication cheefely wee may fully perceyue saint augustine dissoloweth alloweth matter although hee finde fault young bishoppes ouerhasty excommunicating gentleman namely whole houshoulde condemning hee misseconceyued fault yet doth hee dissalowe censure hee beeing bishop selfe others ioyned hee alloweth thereof beene done deseruedly mature deliberation gone offending party yea done yll hee entreateth vndooe ecclesiastical act release censure curse ascribing binding losing bishop although therefore saint augustine doe often affirme power keyes opening shutting binding losing bee giuen church yet hee maketh execution appertayne onely bishop minister word chrysostome likewise east ascribeth power vnto church homilia 2 de dauide saule chrysost homil 2 de dauide saule speaking went stageplayes sermon hee sayth verily thinke many forsooke v yesterday went away spectacle iniquity day present wish might openly knowe might driue sacred porch perpetually tarry without corrected return agayn sith father also driue doores table sonnes oftentimes offend shoulde bee alwayes banished thence beeing made better chastisementhow chrysost woulde excom contemners word may returne father housholds company due commendation truely thing doe pastor also separate scabbed sheep whole eased wretched disease may returne agayne safe vnto sound rather sicke shoulde fill whole flocke disease cause wee desired also knowe although bee able discerne eye word notwithstanding sonne god knowe easily perswade reproouing conscience shoulde returne owne voluntary willingly teaching onely within giue mind worthy exercise contrary hee liuing corruptly partaker congregation although stande present body hee cast remooued hence truely shut dores may partaker holy table expulsed according lawes god tarying without yet good hope bee amende faultes cast church may returne againe pure conscience c heere hee sayth cast church yet hee wisheth hee might openly knowe ende might denounce sentence excommunication doe father disobedient childe shephearde infected sheepe censure comparison shall sinne himselfe god woulde contemne v wee proceede mildlie agaynst man shall contemne binding make christe againe shall correct saying whatsoeuer yee shall binde vpon earth shall bee also bounde augmented double first frutes seedes shall paide saint martyns tydechap 4 first frut • seedes shall haue payde shall fined 40 shilling besides pay 12 time much frutes come man giltie death shall flee sentence kinges shall bee thy nursing father queenes shall bee thy nurse neuerthelesse respect againe bee church child therefore added shall worship thee face towardes earth licke dust thy feeetea third part testimonie left whereto part referred partes prophesy againe referred thirde followeth thou shalt knowe lorde shall bee ashamed waite though sayde church doe thou ascribe vnto thy self vnto
